decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (OGS/14101/01, received 13/03/2014; OGS/14101/05 Rev B, dated 20.05.2014; OGS/14101/06 Rev A, dated 20.05.2014; OGS/14101/07 Rev A, dated 20.05.2014; received 22/05/2014) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 4 - The entire site lies within an Archaeological Priority Area. During construction of the rear extension foundations and for new drainage runs in the vicinity, a watching brief should look out for evidence of earlier fabric. If evidence of old fabric is found the local planning authority should be informed and an investigation and recording of what is found decided upon; if necessary by calling upon English Heritage for expert guidance.
description: Erection of a single storey rear extension to retail unit
